channel.title: Making an Updater
channel.description:
OK, so I've decided that I would take my crack at making an updater. But before I start on it, I want to get the thought process down. If there's any thing to change or add, please let me know.
[ul][li]Download Jar(s)[/li] [li]Extract Jar(s)[/li] [li]Pull client revision[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]Inject Accesssors and transformers(Sorry if the terminology is off)[/li] [li]Repack the Jar(s)[/li] [li]Test[/li][/ul]
I think There's supposed to be something in there dealing with using my own loader, but I"m not entirely sure.[/list]

im refactoring the 560 client that came out before the ‘ninja update’ (as frank_ calls it)

Read full topic

item.title: Making an Updater
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“ownagesbot, post:11, topic:300900”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=397185.msg2949826#msg2949826 date=1252437828]
OH, ok I know what you mean know. I was going to do that aswell.
[/quote]Good luck, alot of it isn’t easy to remove.[/quote]
Well the ones you need for your patterns are:
Removing IXOR’s (not easy but not hard either)
Simplifying shifts (easy)
Removing unused code (int i = jl * 125 % 33423 kind of shit) (easy)
Fixing control flow (easy)

Others can be useful but not really required.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:300900”]You should try to deobfuscate it as much as possible before looking for patterns, it will make it so much easier on you in the long run and they will break less.[/quote]this was what I meant zyle1992

item.title: Making an Updater

item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:4, topic:300900”]if by testing you mean manually testing them, then there should be no need for that. if you actually found a good pattern, then the only thing that would make it ‘incorrect’ would be the actual breaking[/quote]wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww

testing = finding breaks
